tip.text: Enter surname. You may use wildcards: '%' = any sequence of letters; '_' = any single letter.
Enter forename. You may use wildcards: '%' = any sequence of letters; '_' = any single letter.
Select diocese. Once selected you may if you wish choose a specific location under the jurisdiction of the bishop of that diocese in 'Location' below.

Activate by selecting a 'Diocese' in the box above. Select a specific location from a list of all those under the jurisdiction of the bishop of the diocese selected. Locations include parishes, chapels, diocesan and cathedral offices, schools, gaols, hospitals and workhouses.
Select start and end dates to limit the search to persons whose clerical careers fell wholly or in part within the chosen period.
Enter surname. You may use wildcards: '%' = any sequence of letters; '_' = any single letter.
Enter forename. You may use wildcards: '%' = any sequence of letters; '_' = any single letter.

Enter text to search for persons (career narratives) associated with a particular location (parish, chapel, cathedral or diocesan office, gaol, hospital, school, workhouse). You may use wildcards: '%' = any sequence of letters; '_' = any single letter.

Select a diocese here to search for persons (career narratives) involved in events associated with a particular episcopal jurisdiction. This will exclude events associated with peculiars under others' jurisdiction within the diocese's territory, but include those associated with the diocesan cathedral and diocesan officers. Selection will activate 'jurisdiction archdeaconry' and, in combination with selection of 'Ordination' in 'Event' box, 'ordinary'.
Activate by selecting a diocese in 'Jurisdiction diocese'. Use list to select a more precise jurisdiction within the jurisdiction of the diocese selected (archdeaconry, cathedral, peculiar etc.)

Select a diocese here to search for persons occurring within the territorial boundaries of a diocese. Note this will include events occurring in peculiar jurisdictions, but exclude those associated with cathedrals and diocesan officers. under , a particular episcopal jurisdiction. This will exclude events associated with peculiars under others' jurisdiction within the diocese's territory.

Activate by selecting a diocese in 'Geographical Diocese'. Use list to select a more limited region of the diocese, based on its archdeaconries but ignoring small anomalies such as peculiar jurisdictions.
Use list to limit search to persons (career narratives) associated with a particular pre-1832 county.
Select from list to limit search persons (career narratives) involved in events of a particular type. Choosing 'Appointment' activates 'Office'; choosing 'Ordination' activates 'Clerical Status'.

Activate by selecting 'Appointment' in 'Event' box. Select from list to limit search to appointments or persons (career narratives) involved in appointments to a particular clerical office (E.g. vicar, rector, curate).

Activate by selecting 'ordination' in 'Event' box and a diocese in 'Jurisdiction diocese'. Limit search to persons ordained by/ordination events conducted by a particular bishop chosen from the list provided.
Activate by selecting 'ordination' in 'Event' box. Limit search to persons ordained to/ordination events relating to particular levels of clerical status (deacon, priest, bishop etc.)
Activate by choosing 'Appointment' in 'Event' box above. Select from list to limit search to events involving/persons benefiting from patrons of a particular type.
Activate by choosing 'Appointment' in 'Event' box above. Select from list to limit search to events involving/persons benefiting from patrons of one or mixed gender.

Activate by choosing 'Appointment' in 'Event' box above. Enter name to limit search to events involving/persons benefiting from patrons with the 'surname' entered. You may use wildcards: '%' = any sequence of letters; '_' = any single letter.
Select start and end dates to limit the search to a particular period. This limits the search to persons based on their career narratives: persons whose career overlaps the period selected.
